# constrainScroll(_:)

**Instance Method**

Returns a scroll point adjusted from the proposed new origin, if necessary, to guarantee the view will lie within its document view.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func constrainScroll(_ newOrigin: NSPoint) -> NSPoint
```

## Parameters

- **newOrigin**: Origin proposed.

## Return Value

A point which will guarantee the view will lie within its document view.

## Discussion

For example, if the x-coordinate of `newOrigin` lies to the left of the document view’s origin, then the x-coordinate returned is set to that of the x-coordinate of the document view’s origin.

## Scrolling

- **scroll(to:)**: Changes the origin of the clip view’s bounds rectangle to `newOrigin`.
- **autoscroll(with:)**: Scrolls the clip view proportionally to `theEvent`’s distance outside of it.
- **constrainBoundsRect(_:)**: Constrains the bounds of the clip view while the user is magnifying and scrolling.
